message.content:
There are many ways to learn computer programming, and choosing the best method depends on your learning style, interest in specific languages or technologies, and goals. Here are ten methods to learn:

1) Online coding tutorials: Websites like Codecademy, Coursera, Udacity or FreeCodeCamp offer beginner-to-advanced lessons in various programming languages.

2) Books: If you prefer traditional books for studying, countless options of textbooks from reputable authors teach different aspects of programming.

3) Coding Bootcamps: These immersive courses provide a fast-paced introduction to various programming fields (e.g., web development). In-person and online bootcamps usually last between 3 to 6 months.

4) University Courses: Colleges often have computer science programs with comprehensive curriculums that span several years. Many universities also offer shorter non-degree classes focusing on specific skills/technologies.

5) YouTube Tutorials & Podcasts: Learning through video/audio content can be useful for some learners; numerous YouTube channels (e.g., The New Boston or Traversy Media), along with tech-related podcasts may prove helpful during your studies.

6) Blogs & Developer Forums: Reading articles written by experienced developers will strengthen your understanding of the field while giving access to real-world examples/case studies. Frequenting developer forums like StackOverflow allows exposure/involvement within the community as well as finding solutions when overcoming obstacles throughout the learning process.
 
7 ) MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses): Platforms like Coursera and edX frequently host numerous free/paid computer programming courses created by world-renowned professors/universities.

8.) Attend Workshops/conferences/meetups/hackathons â€“ Learn from local professionals through workshops/trainings/events available
